titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Van Broughton Ramsey Accessions
titlestmt.author: Katie Salzmann

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-23 13:13:58 -0500.

change.item: Revised for ArchivesSpace by Katie Salzmann

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Van Broughton Ramsey Accessions
did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site. Advance notice is required for use: https://www.thewittliffcollections.txstate.edu/research/makearesearchappointment.html.
did.abstract: The archive of Emmy-award winning costume designer, Van Broughton Ramsey spans 1980-2014 and measures 32 boxes. The bulk of the collection comprises his design binders for various projects; these are arranged according to genre: plays, films, television movies, television mini-series, and television series.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Van Broughton Ramsey Accessions, The Wittliff Collections, Texas State University.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials from the Wittliff Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. The user assumes responsibility for determining copyright status, obtaining permission to publish, and abiding by U.S. copyright laws. https://www.thewittliffcollections.txstate.edu/research/visit/policies/publication.html

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The archive of Emmy-award winning costume designer, Van Broughton Ramsey spans 1980-2014 and measures 32 boxes. The bulk of the collection comprises his design binders for various projects; these are arranged according to genre: plays, films, television movies, television mini-series, and television series. There is one binder for his work designing the walk-around costume McGolf, an official mascot of the PGA. There are also several binders containing detailed research files, most arranged by decade, but some by project (boxes 24-27).

The collection includes numerous original sketches for his projects. Many are housed within the design binders (boxes 2-23), but there are also a number of sketches in folders in box 1 and in oversized boxes 28-32. Character plots (charts used to plan costumes and budgets) are likewise housed within some binders, but there are also several oversized in box 32.

Some other highlights of the collection are letters from Lilian Gish, Bill Wittliff, and Glenn Close; the booklet from the Costume Designer's Guild's career achievement award which Ramsey was awarded in 2009; playbills from numerous productions; and clippings and ephemera relating to his work.

did.unittitle: Accession 2019-007

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The archive of Emmy-award winning costume designer, Van Broughton Ramsey spans 1980-2013 and measures 32 boxes. The bulk of the collection comprises his design binders for various projects; these are arranged according to genre: plays, films, television movies, television mini-series, and television series. There is one binder for his work designing the walk-around costume McGolf, an official mascot of the PGA. There are also several binders containing detailed research files, most arranged by decade, but some by project (boxes 24-27).

The collection includes numerous original sketches for his projects. Many are housed within the design binders (boxes 2-23), but there are also a number of sketches in folders in box 1 and in oversized boxes 28-32. Character plots (charts used to plan costumes and budgets) are likewise housed within some binders, but there are also several oversized in box 32.

Some other highlights of the collection are letters from Lilian Gish, Bill Wittliff, and Glenn Close; the booklet from the Costume Designer's Guild's career achievement award which Ramsey was awarded in 2009; playbills from numerous productions; and clippings and ephemera relating to his work.

Costume Sketches

scopecontent.head: Sub-Series Description
scopecontent.p: Costume sketches by Van Broughton Ramsey for a variety of plays and films.

did.unittitle: Courtship: 10 original costume sketches
1918: 23 original costume sketches
1918: Photographs of Matthew Broderick and other cast members. Also photos of On Valentines Day, and Mary Steenburgen in End of the Line
Habitation of Dragons: 7 original costume sketches; 14 "color plot" pages
Dangerous Corner: 4 original costume sketches
The Would-be Gentleman: 1 original costume sketch
Einstein and the Polar Bear: Playbill, 13 original costume sketches
Lily Dale: 4 original costume sketches
Valentine's Day: 2 original costume sketches
Lonesome Dove: 1 original costume sketch for Clara
"Costumes for my agent's children" Wizard, Leprechaun, Ritual robe
Plays

scopecontent.head: Sub-Series Description
scopecontent.p: Binders containing scripts, sketches, budgets, and character plots for a variety of plays. Arranged alphabetically by play title.

did.unittitle: Frankie and Johnny are Married. Written and directed by Michael Pressman (Black 3" binder)
The Habitation of Dragons. Written by Horton Foote. Pittsburgh Public Theatre Production (Black 3" binder)

Hello Again. "Play-Musical" (Black 1" binder)
Roberto Zucco. Written by Bernard-Marie Koltès; directed by Russell Milton (Black 1" binder)
The Trip to Bountiful "Play on Broadway." Written by Horton Foote; directed by Michael Wilson. Starring Cicely Tyson, Cuba Gooding, Jr., Vanessa Williams, and Condola Rashad (White 3" binder)
The Trip to Bountiful. Script for Broadway production (Orange 1" binder)
The Trip to Bountiful. Rehearsal script for Broadway production (Black 1" binder)
The Trip to Bountiful "Play at Ahmanson, L.A." Written by Horton Foote; directed by Michael Wilson. Starring Cicely Tyson, Blair Underwood, and Vanessa Williams (Black 1.5" binder)
The Trip to Bountiful. Performance script for Ahmanson production, Los Angeles (Black 1" binder)
The Trip to Bountiful. "CTG-LA Play" CTG Casting Shop (Blue 1" binder)

Horton Foote's The Trip to Bountiful. "TV Movie" Prepared by Hallie Foote and Michael Wilson, directed by Michael Wilson. Starring Cicely Tyson, Blair Underwood, and Vanessa Williams (Black 1" binder)
The Widow Claire "Off-Broadway Play." Written by Horton Foote, directed by Michael Lindsay-Hogg and starring Matthew Broderick. Circle in the Square Theatre, New York (Blue 3" binder)
The Widow Claire "Play: NY" Screenplay by Horton Foote (Teal 1" binder)
Wooden Breeks "Play in L.A." Written by Glen Berger (Black 3" binder)
Films

scopecontent.head: Sub-Series Description
scopecontent.p: Binders containing scripts, costume sketches, research materials, production notes, and other documentation for film projects. Arranged chronologically by broadcast date of the films.

did.unittitle: Courtship. Written by Horton Foote, directed by Howard Cummings and starring William Converse-Roberts, Horton Foote, Jr., Hallie Foote, and Daisy Foote. "Drawing for my first movie with Horton Foote." (Small black 1" binder)
Courtship. (Black 3" binder)
End of the Line. Directed by Jay Russell and starring Kevin Bacon and Mary Steenburgen. (Red 3" binder)
Silent Tongue. Written and directed by Sam Shepard, starring Alan Bates, Richard Harris, Joaquin Phoenix, and Dermot Mulroney. (Black 3" binder)
The Stars Fell on Henrietta. Directed by James Keach and starring Robert Duvall. Script. (Lavender 1" binder)
The Stars Fell on Henrietta. Directed by James Keach and starring Robert Duvall. (Navy 3" binder)
The Tripper. Written by and directed by David Arquette and starring Arquette and Courtney Cox. (Maroon 2" binder)
Albert Nobbs. "I only did the screen test in L.A., but not the movie in Ireland." Directed by Rodrigo García and starring Glenn Close. (Black 2" binder)
All is Lost. Written and directed by J. C. Chandor and starring Robert Redford. (Blue 3" binder)
All is Lost. Script. (White 1" binder)
A Night in Old Mexico. Written by William D. Wittliff and directed by Emilio Aragón; starring Robert Duvall. (Black 3" binder)
A Night in Old Mexico. Research. (Black 3" binder)
A Night in Old Mexico ["Skydance"]. Orders and receipts. (White 3" binder)
A Night in Old Mexico ["Skydance"]. Orders and receipts. (Gray 2" binder)
A Night in Old Mexico. Script. (Black 1" binder)
A Night in Old Mexico ["Skydance"]. Script. (Blue 1" binder)
This Isn't Happening (Independent short). Written by Thomas Carty and Russell Milton; directed by Carty. (Blue 1" binder)
"Jane" (unproduced). "Slated film starring Melanie Griffith and Howard Stern: ended in law suit." (Red 3" binder)
"Lily Dale" (unproduced). "Postponed, and I did not design the movie." (Black 3" binder)
"Lily Dale" (unproduced). Screenplay by Horton Foote. (Black 3" binder)
"Of Scent of Mind" (unproduced). Written by Niklaus Hilber and Drew Bird. (Black 2" binder)
"A Walk in the Woods" (unproduced). Written by Michael Arndt, based on Bill Bryson's memoir. (Maroon 1" binder)
Television Movies

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Binders containing scripts, costume designs, research, photographs, and other production materials for television movies. Arranged chronologically by broadcast date.

Our Sons. Directed by John Erman and starring Ann-Margret, Julie Andrews and Hugh Grant. (Black 3" binder)

The Tempest. Script and continuity breakdown. (Black 2" binder)
The Tempest. Continuity breakdown and Polaroids. (Black 4" binder)

And the Beat Goes On: The Sonny and Cher Story. Costume chart and script. (Black 1" binder)
Sarah, Plain and Tall: Winter's End. Directed by Glenn Jordan and starring Glenn Close, Christopher Walken, and Jack Palance. (Black 3" binder)
Sarah, Plain and Tall: Winter's End. Costume chart and script. (Maroon 1" binder)
The Ballad of Lucy Whipple. Directed by Jeremy Kagen and starring Glenn Close, Jena Malone, Bruce McGill, and Meat Loaf. (White 3" binder)

Television Mini-series

scopecontent.head: Sub-Series Description
scopecontent.p: Binders containing scripts, costume designs, research, and other production materials relating to various television mini-series. Arranged chronologically by broadcast date.

did.unittitle: Lonesome Dove. William D. Wittliff adaptation of Larry McMurty's novel, Directed by Simon Wincer and starring Robert Duvall, Tommy Lee Jones, Diane Lane, and Anjelica Huston. Fabric swatches. (Canvas Lonesome Dove 1: binder)
The Fire Next Time. Directed by Tom McLoughlin and starring Craig T. Nelson. (Black 3" binder)

Oldest Living Confederate Widow Tells All. Directed by Ken Cameron and starring Diane Lane, Cicely Tyson, and Donald Sutherland. (Black 3" binder)

Buffalo Girls. "Anjelica as Calamity Jane," continuity Polaroids (Black 3" binder)
Buffalo Girls. Continuity Polaroids (Black 3" binder)
The Feasts of All Saints. John Wilder adaptation of Anne Rice novel. Directed by Peter Medak and starring Robert Ri'chard, Peter Gallagher, Gloria Reubens, and Jennifer Beals. (White 3" binder)
The Feasts of All Saints. Script (Blue 3" binder)
Helen of Troy. Directed by John Kent Harrison and starring Emilia Fox, James Callis, and Daniel Lapaine. Costume designs 1 of 2 (Black 3" binder; pages damaged in flood and need to be iron pressed)

Helen of Troy. Script (White 3" binder)
Helen of Troy. Orders and receipts (Green soft-cover 1" binder)
Helen of Troy. Orders and receipts (Yellow soft-cover 1" binder)
Comanche Moon. Written by Larry McMurtry and Diana Ossana. Directed by Simon Wincer and starring Steve Zahn, Ryan Merriman, and Keith Robinson. (Black 3" binder)
Comanche Moon. Script. (Green 3" binder)
Comanche Moon. Research. (Black 2" binder)
Comanche Moon. Research. (White 2" binder)
Comanche Moon. Script. (Black 3" binder)
Comanche Moon. "The Costumes of Comanche Moon" Softcover booklet for Emmy consideration. "the sketch notebooks were lost in our move to N.Y.; these are the only sketches." (includes CD)
Television Series

scopecontent.head: Sub-Series Description
scopecontent.p: Binders containing scripts, costume designs, research, and other production materials for various television series. Arranged chronologically by broadcast date. Also included is the design binder for Billy McGolf, a walk-around character for the PGA.

scopecontent.head: Sub-Series Description
scopecontent.p: Binders containing research on clothing, accessories, and styles for a variety of eras and also for a number of specific projects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Original oversized watercolor sketches of costumes for various plays and film projects.
